column1: During the cadastral reform of the early Meiji period in 1889

column1: Fujieda has a mayor-council form of government with a directly elected mayor and a unicameral city legislature of 22 members.

Fujieda has 17 public elementary schools and ten public junior high schools operated by the city government. and three public high schools operated by the Shizuoka Prefectural Board of Education. There are also two private middle schools and  three private high schools. The prefectural also operates one special education school for disabled children. In addition
